intro: Kedrostis ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Kedrostis ledermannii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is a hardy species well-suited to dry climates.
